column4: I have question for you how can I get power-top in Ubuntu Linux to run at start up, this is powertop it manages low power consumption mode in Ubuntu Linux -> https://help.ubuntu.com/community/PowerManagement/ReducedPower
My laptop usually heats up hot in Ubuntu Linux that is why I use low power mode
How would you get this command to run at startup everytime you boot up into Ubuntu Linux->sudo -i pm-powersave true
http://www.lesswatts.org
You could put it in /etc/rc.local
Only drop the sudo part
okay let me try that and see it workd
The command does not look right
I am working off of this document - >https://help.ubuntu.com/community/PowerManagement/ReducedPower
My question is I cannot get this command to run at startup boot - >pm-powersave true
what happens when you run it from command line?
I entered this in /etc/rc.local ->pm-powersave true
Without being root I get this response -> We do not own /var/log/pm-powersave.log, refusing to overwrite.
service --status-all   #See if it shows up in that list.
Nope only works when I run sudo -i pm-powersave true
did you put   pm-powesave true   in /etc/rc.local  ?
Use and I rebooted and it didn't start
did you install laptop-mode-tools ?
ls -l /etc/rc.local   #See if the executable bit is enabled.
see my pm
Going to try this http://kenjiru.ro/blog/lucid-lynx
